text: Leo Vroman (April 10, 1915 â€“ February 22, 2014) was a Jewish-Dutch-American hematologist, a writer and a poet (mainly writing in Dutch) and an illustrator. ==Early life== Vroman was born in Gouda. He studied biology at Utrecht University. When the Nazis occupied the Netherlands on May 10, 1940, he went to London. ===Education=== After the war, Vroman went to New York. There he worked as a hematology researcher. He has been an American citizen since 1951. ==Death== Vroman spent his last years in Fort Worth, Texas.
